image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Did JD Vance pose with three women at boys' urinals? 'It had a message'
item.description: ​A photo of a young JD Vance posing with three women at a boys' urinal has surfaced on social media. The three women pretended to be using the urinals while JD was standing behind them. No context given, the photo is going viral with people commenting how weird JD Vance is around women. According to DailyMail which claimed to have sourced the photo exclusively from the 2003 yearbook of Vance's school, the photo had a special messaging.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President Joe Biden supports calls for new election in Venezuela amid disputed vote
item.description: US President Biden endorsed the call for new elections in Venezuela after President Maduro's contested victory. The State Department highlighted transparency concerns. Brazilian President Lula suggested a coalition government, but opposition leader Maria Corina Machado opposed further elections. Venezuela has not released the full voting tallies, prompting international discussions on a political solution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian court sentences US-Russian dual national to 12 years in prison for $52 Ukraine charity donation
item.description: A Russian court sentenced US-Russian dual national Ksenia Khavana to 12 years for treason over a $52 donation to a Ukrainian charity. Khavana, a former ballet dancer, pleaded guilty after being detained in Yekaterinburg. US officials condemned the conviction, with plans to appeal underway. This case heightens concerns for US nationals in Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk sells 16,000-square-foot mansion, his last remaining home in San Francisco area
item.description: Elon Musk found a buyer for his last residential property, a historic mansion in Hillsborough, California, listed for nearly $32 million. Initially priced at $37.5 million, the estate features a 16,000-square-foot mansion with seven bedrooms, nine and a half bathrooms, and significant technological upgrades. The buyer and final sale price remain undisclosed as the transaction is pending.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: WHO declares mpox a global health emergency: What is mpox, can the virus spread, How can it be stopped
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkey, Iraq sign accord on military, security, counter-terrorism cooperation
item.description: The neighbouring countries have in recent years been at loggerheads over Ankara's cross-border military operations against the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militants based in northern Iraq's mountainous region.

item.title: Secret service agent left Donald Trump at North Carolina, went to breastfeed: Report
item.description: A Secret Service agent on Wednesday afternoon left her position during Donald Trump's rally in North Carolina without informing the site in-charge, reports claimed. Minutes before Trump's motorcade arrived at the venue, the agent departed her post to breastfeed her child in a side room meant for agency work, the report said alleging a major security breach -- a month after Trump was shot in Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 40,000 deaths and counting: The urgent quest for cease-fire amid Israel-Hamas violence
item.description: 40,000 deaths and counting: The urgent quest for cease-fire amid Israel-Hamas violence

item.title: What! Man dresses as Vivek Ramaswamy at Trump's Montana rally. Here's what happened next
item.description: ​An influencer by the name of Dohaa the Explorer claimed he dressed up like Indian-American businessman and former GOP presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy and then attended Donald Trump's Montana rally. He made a full-length YouTube video detailing how he prepared for the prank -- after many of his audience told him that he bore resemble with Vivek.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: House of ousted Myanmar leader Suu Kyi received no bids at second auction attempt
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine using UK-gifted tanks in Russia offensive: Reports
Donald Trump seeks delay in sentencing for hush money case until after November election
item.description: Former President Donald Trump sought a delay in his sentencing for the New York hush money case until after the presidential election. His lawyer argued that proceeding before Election Day could constitute election interference. The legal team emphasised the need for more time due to the complexity of the case and Trump’s campaign as the Republican nominee.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 16 villagers in eastern Congo killed as fighting continues despite a cease-fire
Anti-Israel protesters clash with law enforcement after Kamala Harris rally in NYC
item.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters clashed with law enforcement after storming an afterparty following Vice President Kamala Harris' rally in New York City. Demonstrators caused chaos, shouting and unleashing smoke bombs. Amid protests, Harris addressed the crowd, emphasising democracy and opposing confrontational politics. The Biden administration's support of Israel sparked the demonstrations, highlighting a contentious issue in their campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Arrest made in Matthew Perry death case: Ketamine was arranged for the 'Friends' actor
item.description: ​Almost 10 months after 54-year-old Matthew Perry was found dead in a heated pool at his residence, the law enforcement agencies made multiple arrests from Southern California on Thursday. Perry's personal assistant, two doctors and two other have been indicted and charged with providing Ketamine to the actor that led to his death.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: JD Vance and Tim Walz agree to vice-presidential debate on October 1
item.description: Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance agreed to two debates against Minnesota Governor Tim Walz. Both candidates have accepted CBS News's debate on October 1, and Vance also accepted CNN's proposal for a debate on September 18. Kamala Harris and Donald Trump have scheduled a presidential debate for September 10, hosted by ABC News.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Donald Trump suffering from PTSD? 'Watching same clip of getting shot'
item.description: ​A source close to the campaign told Vanity Fair that Trump has been watching the seven-second clip of how close he was to getting shot in the head over and over again displaying signs of PTSD. Trump has been through a lot and the assassination attempt continues to weigh on him, the report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance's Indian mother-in-law surprised him but he agrees post-menopausal female has this role
item.description: During the 2020 conversation, host Eric said in theory the whole purpose of the postmenopausal female is to take care of their grandchildren. "Yes," Vance said as he spoke about his mother-in--law's decision to take a year-long sabbatical when Usha gave birth. JD Vance has three children -- Evan, 6, Vivek 4, Mirabel 2 and he said he's angling for baby no. 4
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gaza war after 10 months: A look at human cost in Israel and Palestine

item.title: UN rights experts press Bahrain over prison conditions
item.description: Three independent UN rights experts called on the Bahraini authorities Thursday to guarantee the rights of inmates after allegations about punitive conditions in Jau prison in the south. "We urge authorities in Bahrain to guarantee safe, healthy and hygienic conditions of detention to every person currently held in Jau prison," the experts said in a joint statement.
